instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3588: What is 820-3588? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.820-3885: What is 820-3885? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good‚Äù and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.PCH_SRTCRST_L: What is PCH_SRTCRST_L? PCH_SRTCRST_L is a reset signal present for the RTC circuit that asserts when it is low in voltage, that is what _L means..
definitions.PCH_INTVRMEN_L: What is PCH_INTVRMEN_L? PCH_INTVRMEN_L is a signal that stands for Internal Voltage Regulator Enable. When pulled high, this signal enables the internal 1.05 V regulators for the Suspend well in the PCH. This signal must be pulled-up to PPVRTC_G3H..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..
definitions.PPVCCIO_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCIO_S0_CPU? PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is a power rail responsible for powering the part of the CPU responsible for communicating with other portions of the machine prior to PPVCORE_S0_CPU being present and must be present before vcore, PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is present when the machine is in an on, RUNNING state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Got an iMAC where the first LED Blinks on button press but not turning on.
Its not <TRANSISTOR>Q8450</TRANSISTOR> and i have steady 12V
I'm not getting <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> and not pulsing either.
is the criteria for s4 en same as macbook?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
I can find anything about <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3885</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>...
If you have steady <SIGNAL>12V_S5</SIGNAL>, what about <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
apologies, it's <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
Yes I have steady s5 state

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
If S5 LED blinks when you press power button, means that <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is not steady.
So, do you have at least <SIGNAL>12V_S5</SIGNAL> steady all the time?
If not, check around Q/<CHIP>U6970</CHIP>.
Be sure <SIGNAL>12V_G3H</SIGNAL> is stable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
i meant that i have 3.3V for <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and 12v for <SIGNAL>12V_S5</SIGNAL> up till when i click the the power button and it blinks.
means voltage drops to 0 for both lines and go back to 3.3v and 12v shortly after

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
"Be sure <SIGNAL>12V_G3H</SIGNAL> is stable."
If not, change power supply.

Check for short on all big coils.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>12V_G3H</SIGNAL> is rock solid stable, no shorts in all coils.

how do i d a smc bypass mode with an imac??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Press and hold power button.
Insert power cord (previously removed) and release power button after 5-10s.
Then press power button again (shortly).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
didn't know smc bypass works for IMAC as well.
well this time the LED didn't blink but stayed lit all the time. still no boot

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Check for pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> in SMC bypass mode.

See if all PCH's signals are present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
1. <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3HX</SIGNAL>   (VCCRTC) <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3_RTC</SIGNAL>
2. <SIGNAL>RTC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>    (RTCRST#) <SIGNAL>RTC_RST_L</SIGNAL>
3. <SIGNAL>PCH_SRTCRST_L</SIGNAL> (SRTCRST#) 
4. <SIGNAL>PCH_INTVRMEN_L</SIGNAL> (INTVRMEN)
5. <SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN_L</SIGNAL> (DSWVRMEN)
6. <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTCX1</SIGNAL> (RTCX1)
7. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>    (VCCDSW3-3)
8. <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>    (DPWROK)
9. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>    (VCCSUS3)
10. <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>    (BATLOW#)
11. <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL>    (RSMRST#)
+1. <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>    (PWRBTN#)

checked all this and i have 3.3v for all this. no pulsing on <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>. i'm thinking dead PCH

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
"6. <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTCX1</SIGNAL> (RTCX1)"
I suppose you've meant <SIGNAL>PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1</SIGNAL>.
3V there for sure?
In such case, other reason for bad PCH.
Should have 32KHz sine wave there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: My mistake there for copy pasta~, for the SYSclk i have 32khz wave using o-scope.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Try changing PCH.
If works, need to clean ME at the end.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: got PCH replaced, turns on now, FAN SPIN... but no <SIGNAL>GPU_GOOD</SIGNAL>. need clean ME?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
New PCH requires clean ME anyway.
But GPU should work with original BIOS; if not corrupted, of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: This board does not have dedicated gpu. Getting worries now lol

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Yeah <SIGNAL>GPU_GOOD</SIGNAL> comes out from PCH and means iGPU is in working condition.
Which is not your case; your board doesn't reach that state.

LED0302 is steady on?
Check if you get CPU core voltage (L7110/30/50).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
ok did clean ME(First time though so many tutorials and each of them different) [URL='http://File']https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Cl5HcbQ3GCMmZpsEqtNbyOyHceFcg6YH/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

yes LED0302 is steady ON
and i'm getting 1.7V on CPU Core but it i'm getting no HEAT coming from the CPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?
Try one memory module at time, each slot.
Also try full known good BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 0v
same goes for the RAM, tried each slot and swap them with known good.
also flash with good bios same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
You must get <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> high.
Seems that power on sequence is not completed.
Post <CHIP>U8600</CHIP>/1 voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: <CHIP>U8600</CHIP> all pins 3.3V except ground. same goes for <CHIP>U8601</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
So, both <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> are high.
What about <SIGNAL>PM_MEM_PWRGD</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_MEM_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 0.8v

edit
<SIGNAL>PPVCCIO_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CPU_VIDSCLK</SIGNAL> is also 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: so follow this chart for power up sequence [URL]https://logi.wiki/index.php/Bootup_Signal_Order[/URL] i'm getting stuck at CPU VR Ready that's why i'm missing <SIGNAL>LPC_PWRDWN_L</SIGNAL>. but i can't find <SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL> in the schematics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
It is <SIGNAL>REG_CPUVCC_PGOOD</SIGNAL> (<SIGNAL>VR_RDY</SIGNAL>).
Should be high, as you get CPU core.

Check =<SIGNAL>PM_PGOOD_MEM_S0</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
so.. weird thing happened, system was running, fan spinning, as soon as i put my probe on <RESISTOR>R8430</RESISTOR>, it shuts down and reboot. this is repeatable, and no i did not short something out.

i leave my probe on the point, system starts up. shows me 3v3v. remove and probe again, shuts down

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Does the board boot in such condition?
Check for USB activity, or external video, if the board is alone on the desk.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: Sorry, system running as in I only have led0302 still no gpu good. And no cpu activity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Yeah, difficult to understand a post, when is written in such manner.
I now suppose that you've meant to say the board reboots when you touch <SIGNAL>PM_PGOOD_FET_P1V35_S0</SIGNAL> line with multimeter probe.

Has <RESISTOR>R8430</RESISTOR> correct 22K value?
Do you get <SIGNAL>PVDDQ_S0_FET</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R8430</RESISTOR>  has 22k

i'm getting 1.34V on  <SIGNAL>PVDDQ_S0_FET</SIGNAL>.
the board reboots not only when i touch  <SIGNAL>PM_PGOOD_FET_P1V35_S0</SIGNAL> line, it also happens when i touch <RESISTOR>R8535</RESISTOR> pin2/<SIGNAL>PM_EN_REG_CPUVCC_S0</SIGNAL> side as well

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: I supposed you get  <SIGNAL>REG_CPUVCC_PGOOD</SIGNAL>, but not sure now; you've said didn't find <SIGNAL>VR_READY</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: Yes i do get  <SIGNAL>REG_CPUVCC_PGOOD</SIGNAL>, yeah earlier i said i didn't know where on it on schematic. and i have 3.3v on this line

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
You cannot get away, without <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.
Seems that PCH doesn't properly detect that power on sequence finished.

The new PCH may be bad, or broken traces/solders underneath.
Could also be a CPU problem, less probably.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Replaced another PCH. i have good news! i have <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and my CPU Vcore is 1.76V
CPU Heats up so i know its running. 
BUT! i now do not have <SIGNAL>GPU_GOOD</SIGNAL>. no chime no display no light on LED0303.
only lights on at LED0302 and LED0301
Sorry man this is taking so long. i appreciate your assistance here

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: Did you flash BIOS again?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: yes, i did flash again but still getting the same outcome.
